intro: Muraltia divaricata, commonly known as the red mombin or yellow mombin, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive reddish or purple coloration when young. The flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, yellow or orange fruits that are edible.
